intro: Selliguea crenatopinnata, commonly known as the serrated frond moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, lobed fronds that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually thin and have a distinct serrated or wavy edge, contributing to its common name. Selliguea crenatopinnata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various small organisms.
